api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World greeting message in JSON format

component_logic.responsibility: Sets up HTTP server framework and configures the GET /hello route handler

interfaces.description: Start the HTTP server on specified host and port
Register all API routes including GET /hello

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI framework for HTTP server setup. Create FastAPI application instance. Register GET /hello route by calling register_routes(). Start server using uvicorn.run() with host='0.0.0.0' and port=8000. Implement graceful shutdown handling. Use standard logging for server startup/shutdown events.

component_logic.responsibility: Implements response serialization and returns Hello World JSON payload

interfaces.description: Return Hello World greeting as JSON dictionary
Serialize message into JSON response format

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement get_hello() as FastAPI route handler decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Return dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. Use FastAPI's automatic JSON serialization (no manual json.dumps() needed). Handler should be synchronous function returning dict. FastAPI will automatically convert dict to JSON response with Content-Type: application/json and status code 200.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify route handler is properly registered with HTTP framework
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: GET /hello endpoint must be registered in FastAPI application using @app.get('/hello') decorator. Route must be accessible at http://localhost:8000/hello

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint returns valid JSON response
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must be valid JSON with Content-Type: application/json. Response body must contain exactly {"message": "Hello World"}. HTTP status code must be 200 OK.
Server must start on host 0.0.0.0 and port 8000. Server must be accessible from localhost. No startup errors or exceptions.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint responds quickly without unnecessary processing
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Endpoint must return response in less than 100ms. No database queries, file I/O, or external API calls. Direct in-memory response generation.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format is consistent and correct
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must always return exactly {"message": "Hello World"} with no variations. Message value must be exactly 'Hello World' (case-sensitive).

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component separation and single responsibility
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldServer handles HTTP framework setup and routing. HelloWorldHandler handles response generation. No mixing of concerns between components.

architecture_overview: Simple two-tier architecture with HTTP server layer and request handler layer. HelloWorldServer component initializes FastAPI framework and registers routes. HelloWorldHandler component implements the GET /hello endpoint logic that returns a JSON response with 'Hello World' message. No database, caching, or external dependencies required. Stateless request processing with automatic JSON serialization by FastAPI.
assumptions: Server runs on localhost:8000 by default
HTTP GET requests to /hello should return JSON response
No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response message is static and always 'Hello World'
FastAPI automatic JSON serialization is used (no manual json.dumps needed)
No request parameters or query strings are expected for /hello endpoint
